meanings.sent1: She always grutches about having to do chores.
meanings.sent2: Please don't grutches all the time; it's exhausting to listen to.
meanings.sent3: At the family dinner, Grandpa grutches about the food being too salty.
meanings.sent4: Her constant grutches were like a broken record, repeating the same complaints.
meanings.sent5: The sound of her grutches echoed through the house, filling it with negativity.

meanings.definition: Grutches (noun): feelings of resentment or ill-will
meanings.sent1: His grutches towards his boss were evident in his body language.
meanings.sent2: The siblings' grutches towards each other were causing tension in the household.
meanings.sent3: Despite their grutches, they managed to work together on the project.
meanings.sent4: The grutches between the two teams were palpable, creating a competitive atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: Let go of your grutches and embrace forgiveness for a lighter heart.

meanings.definition: Grutches (adjective): characterized by a tendency to hold grudges
meanings.sent1: She avoided inviting him to the party due to his grutches nature.
meanings.sent2: The grutches coworker always found reasons to be upset with others.
meanings.sent3: His grutches behavior made it challenging for others to trust him.
meanings.sent4: The grutches attitude in the office created a toxic work environment.
meanings.sent5: Living with a grutches mindset only brings negativity into one's life.
